website_summaries.verdict: With an extra-wide mantel, you can gather around this table-style pit for a meal, a fire, or both!
pros: Offers 40,000 BTUs for generous ambiant heat
Door with easy access to tank
Variable settings to set the heat or mood
Mantel is large enough to rest cups or small plates
cons: The screws used to assemble can strip easily

customer_reviews.title: Within a couple of years you will have a rusty box that does nothing but hold a gas tank.
customer_reviews.text: Please dont buy this. It's flimsy, hard to assemble, parts are cheap. I stored it inside in the winter and covered it year round. All of the ceramic tiles around the edge are falling off, leaving rusty metal to gouge someone not paying attention, especially a child walking by. Even when it was brand new it didnt generate a lot of heat, and the table top isnt at a height or wide enough to sit and have a meal on. The best it could do is hold a drink, but the ceramic is uneven so it doesnt even do a great job at that.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Love it now, but need costly and time consuming fixes
customer_reviews.text: It took my husband a day of extra work and $200 more to follow the reviewers video and change the burner to stainless steel 12". We tried all other shortcuts to stop the toxic smell and nothing else worked. ( Had we done it staight away would have saved some time) Made the adjustments to convert it to glass as well. Love it now but I'm not sure you couldnt find another pit that is ready to go without all the extra work and cost.
customer_reviews.author: Nickel

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I bought this as a Christmas present because of all the good reviews. We just put it together because it's just now nice out and it won't stay lit. We replaced the propane tank and tried resetting the regulator a few times as per the troubleshooting guide and it still keeps going out. I can't return it because I missed that window by a few weeks. I'm reaching out to Blue Rhino hoping maybe they'll send a replacement regulator, but it will probably be the same one and I'll have the same problem. What a huge waste of money. I'm so disappointed. What's worse is I feel like I gave a crappy Christmas present.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Tile started to come off
customer_reviews.text: Puts out a nice fire but the real issue is I bought this table about 4 years ago and the tile has started to come off. It has been covered when not in use. It did sit out during the winter but I the instructions do not say anything regarding not leaving it outside during cold winters. I wouldn't purchase this item again if given the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Toxic smell, smoke and soot
customer_reviews.text: After we put this unit together and fired it up it smoked and put off a toxic smell for hours, then we noticed that black soot was drifting onto our patio furniture. I don't know why this is rated so high. Look at the most viewed review, they tell you how to retro fit the burner with a stainless steel burner. Save yourself a lot of waisted time and buy a fire pit with a stainless steel burner and fire bowl which will last longer. The Fire Sense unit is made from cast aluminum and has a stainless burner and fire bowl..... And no toxic smell. This fire pit is made from cheap stamped steel that will rust quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Soot and smell issue
customer_reviews.text: We have tried everything and are still getting heavy soot and smell. Does Blue Rhino have a solution or a replacement part for the air exchange ?? Love the pit but not acceptable the way it is. Just spoke to blue rhino rep on their 800 number. She told me it is supposed to soot and smell because it is made to simulate a campfire. Because of that response I would totally NOT recommend this pit. The fumes make you nauseous and the rocks/lava/glass are solid black. The company response is totally unacceptable and avoidance of the issue, which by the reviews is a big problem for every buyer.
customer_reviews.author: beachgirl

customer_reviews.title: Not headache free, but still what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Pros Large table area covered in real tile Decent heat Nice appearance Cons Without adjustment it burns too rich. The gas orifice has to be adjusted beyond what the manufactured mount allows, for the fire function to run properly (YouTube videos show how) The gas regulator took a dump and needed to be replaced in the first week. Supplied lava rocks need to larger so they don't fall through the fire grate. Kind of a pain in the ass to put together.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price for a quality Outdoor Grill
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy with my purchase, reasonable price for a quality Outdoor Grill. Love the top made with real stone. I had some left over grout sealer, and gave the top another treatment to bring out a little more color. Instructions were easy to follow, but took more time than I expected (3 hours). Did all of the assembly myself but needed help turning the assembly right side up (you build it upside down with the top on the ground). Flame and logs look good. All screw holes lined up well when loosely assembled and then I tightened screws as suggested in instructions. Delivery was on-time and the heavy box was set on my patio for convenient assembly.
customer_reviews.author: White Haired Old Fart

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality of the top slate, but the estructure is seems weak and cheap, and putting it together not only is difficult but the screws a really bad quality so you stripped them easily if you are using a drill like hubby, but if you use an screwdriver, God help you cause is gonna take you forever. The rocks smell really bad, like fuel or something, really strong smell even though after a month of using it almost everyday,when you turn it on, you have to wait or try several times, when is on I have to blow so the flame comes through the rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia H.

customer_reviews.title: IF YOUR FLAME GOES OUT WHEN YOU RELEASE THE CONTROL BUTTON PLEAAAASSSEEE READ!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! It was a little confusing to put it together and definitely works better if you have two people working together. The only thing is....after putting it together we could not get it to remain lit no matter how long we held the button in. As soon as we let the button go, the flame would die. After a little research we discovered that there is a small screw attached to the copper wire under the burner assembly bowl....MAKE SURE THIS SCREW IS AT A MINIMUM HAND TIGHTHEN OTHERWISE YOUR FLAME WILL NOT REMAIN LIT! Now that we have it lit we are in love!
customer_reviews.author: Lady J.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking firebowl
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this firebowl for our mountain lot. It sits on the deck and looks amazing. The controls are easy to get to as well as the propane tank. The color has held up for two summers. This takes at least two people to put together. The cover that they include is very cheaply made and tears very easily on the corners. I would like a little more heat from the unit but this was expected. We love the area around the fire for our drinks and food. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pegster47

customer_reviews.title: Great fire place
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews about the black smoke, and have had no issue with it at all. The top is slate, with an edge that looks like it may be small pieces of marble. My patio is slate, and looks really nice. This fire pit looks great, puts out a good amount of heat, and was pretty painless to put together, but took about an hour. One note is that you should definitely get a separate cover, the cover it comes with is very thin and plastic and tore the second time I took it off on the corner of the table.
customer_reviews.author: P. Van Fleet

customer_reviews.title: Quality Fire Pit
customer_reviews.text: Interestingly this was the third fire pit that I ordered. The first 2 were not through Amazon and was delivered damaged. Third the me through Amazon was a charm. The instruction were well written, but I still hate having to use an Allen wrench ( there are quite a few bolts that require use of Allen wrench to tighten.) The final product works nicely and the logs provided add a nice look. Unit comes with a propane tank cover and a fire pit cover. Started with first push button igniter and heated quickly. Tile on top looks nice and it is a large tabletop.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell J. Drucker

customer_reviews.title: 120 days or more to get parts
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and was reasonably easy to put together. I have owned several. Unfortunately, this one didn’t work due to a defect in the bowl assembly. I called customer service to have them send me another bowl assembly as was still under warranty. I was told it would take at least 120 days and possible longer to get me the bowl assembly. That is absolutely ridiculous. You will be rolling the dice if you purchase anything from Blue Rhino and need any parts.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: You will definitely need 2 people to assemble it.
customer_reviews.text: This gas fire pit arrived exactly in the time frame stated! He even brought it around to the back yard. We got it assembled in about 3 hours. It was a hot day and we rested a few times, so maybe it would take someone else less time. We checked that it is working properly and so far it does. It looks very nice on the back patio, so I know we will enjoy it in the cool evenings!
customer_reviews.author: ajs

customer_reviews.title: Some Parts Bent or Missing
customer_reviews.text: This is our second unit. First one lasted eight years in the mountains. We bought the same unit because it fits well and is attractive. Assembly took a solid three hours for someone who is handy, and it needs a second person for turning over and moving. Several metal pieces were bent despite being well packaged. Unit missing one of four feet, which is simply bad quality control at the factory. Unit fit and finish is acceptable, but not great, ie doors do not close smoothly despite exact assembly. Overall pleased once the assembly headache is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jennison

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fire pit but whoever wrote & illustrated the instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fire pit but whoever wrote & illustrated the instructions is a complete moron. We tried it the way the instructions said - but then ended up having to take it apart 2 times to fix it the right way. The pics in the instructions are useless and the verbiage doesn't help at all. Once together its great - but what should have taken 30 mins - took 3 hours. I would not buy this again unless it came assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiles will fall off!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this fire pit for a little over 4 years. I paid a little more because I wanted one that would last. This year, all the tiles are falling off the top. It was pretty while it lasted!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and would buy again in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.text: Money very well spent. I have had this thing for 8 years and it is still going strong. The pull out tray that the tank is on is beginning to rust but even if it fails, I could just set the tank inside out of the way with no problem. Anyway, it takes quite awhile(3 hours) to set up and some of the holes don't line up perfectly, but you will figure it out. Excellent product and would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: john baker

customer_reviews.title: What looks like a heavy duty steel frame base is actually thinly ...
customer_reviews.text: The only positive aspect of this item is that it came well packaged in a heavy duty corrugated box. What looks like a heavy duty steel frame base is actually thinly pressed metal panels connected together using small machine screws. The entire support structure is minimally engineered. It looks OK from a distance, but if you get up close, you'll quickly notice the poor quality components, fit and finish. If/when I sell this house, I'll be leaving this Chinese made POS right where it sits. I really feel like I wasted $500. I cannot recommend buying this item, and knowing what I now know, I would not purchase another Fire Table from UniFlame (Marketed through Blue Rhino).
customer_reviews.author: MBCRIS

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my deck.
customer_reviews.text: This came in a very heavy box but was easy to put together if you can follow instructions with precision. As others have mentioned it is important to put all the frame screws in before they are tightened. It takes two to turn it right side up when finished and is a lot easier to do if you assemble it on a table. It has stood up to the weather over the last year with a good aftermarket cover. The cover included is flimsy and not great. Also, pro tip: turn the gas off at the tank when you put it away for the off season, not just at the control knob.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Walker

customer_reviews.title: Gas Smells horrible
customer_reviews.text: The firepit itself is very pretty, u fortunately the smell of gas is just too much to bare. Right when we decided to return it, we learned that the last day to return was exactly a month after purchase day. It’s too bad because for that price, just sitting in my backyard, a total waste of money for us since no one can take the smell
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Balcarcel

customer_reviews.title: making it easy to organized once I unwrapped them
customer_reviews.text: The grille was very well packaged on arrival. The hardware (screws, bolts, etc.) was individually labeled on the front and back, making it easy to organized once I unwrapped them. The directions were very good as well and I had this put together in under two hours. I also like the propane tank cover to help keep it concealed, and the grille cover is sufficient. The tile is real, and looks great. Overall I would absolutely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ru4therepublic

customer_reviews.title: Good looking pit but one small problem.
customer_reviews.text: We liked the look of this unit and found the price to be very inexpensive compared to the patio stores we looked at. All in the $2000 range. The only issue was we assumed you could use glass in this fire pit but find out only the lava rocks will work. But it is a good looking pit although the sides are a little flimsy and very very difficult to put together mainly because of the poor instructions. Love the slate top, very study and large enough to set drinks. If you're looking for the decorative glass, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: San Fran Man

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing at all levels
customer_reviews.text: After an hour, my husband and I called the neighbor to help assemble this. It took him 3 more hours. He is a Particle Physicist. The directions sucked. Parts were not labeled. Tiles were scratched up upon receipt. I would continue my search for an easy to assemble firepit if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Spier

customer_reviews.title: Great firepit.  Good value for the dollars.  Manufacturer service was lacking.....
customer_reviews.text: The Endless Summer product is solid, easy to assemble and a good value for the size and quality. The original order unfortunately arrived without any hardawre. The replacement hardware was ordered from the manufacturer, Blue Rhino, however i found ourt a week later by calling Blue Rhino that parts were on backorder without any estimate of arrival date. Had to return the original and have Amazon ship a new unit. Amazon was of great help. I have not yet, after 6 weeks, gotten parts for a warranty replacement nor any update from Blue Rhino. Certainly not the same attention to the customer as Amazon has been.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your time or money. It was a pain to put together, pretty flimsy and it doesn't work. Igniter works on occasion even after putting in a new battery but I still have to light it with a match. The fire goes out after several minutes and I have to keep trying to relight it. More of a pain than enjoyable. I even switched out 2 new propane tanks just to make sure that wasn't the problem. I also made sure the rocks were carefully placed so the dust wouldn't get into the center area. Nope. This fire pit just doesn't work. I will definitely be taking this thing apart, boxing it back up and returning it.
customer_reviews.author: MMA2020

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about all the reviews saying it took so long to put together. I laid all the parts, and it only took me an hour to assemble by myself. Assembled on a set of saw horses which made it much easier. Will need a helper at the end to help you turn it upright. Slight confusion at the end, as they say you need to use "A" screws, when you actually use "B" screws. Other than that, very easy to assemble and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: kdc

customer_reviews.title: Watch the install video!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it!!!! I strongly recommend watching YouTube video  on how to assemble for step by step I step by step instructions.... So much easier than the manual. Realistic flame and gives off a lot of heat! Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: chris fiordeliso

customer_reviews.title: Love this🌙
customer_reviews.text: Great looking fire table! Worthy of every penny I paid. The table was delivered on time and Amazon's (Bolingbrook, Il) delivery people were neat, timely, courteous and friendly. I would recommend this table to anyone😘. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: lhejl

customer_reviews.title: 100 % satisfied highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Gives off good heat. I did purchase 2 small battery operated fans to help blow the heat toward the seating area on cooler nights. Putting together is easy but you definitely need 2 people. The tile around the firepit is big enough to hold plates. Only knock is the cover will not last. Corners are sharp and my cover ripped the second time we put it on. Bought aftermarket cover. Definitely need to hold the gas dial in after you light it for a few seconds to hear up. Then it will stay lit. Great purchase. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Grant

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fire bowl works very well. Functions as a use for heat or ambience. I would have rated it a 5 star if the assembly directions were a tad better. I would advise 2 people to put it together. Delivery was good, 2 men put it right where I wanted it, not just curb side. Very happy with my purchase. Only down side is when you put iced drinks on the tiled table they don't stay iced very long. The table gets warm. I purchased 2 small patio tables to place cold beverages on.
customer_reviews.author: Lorene Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Fire Pit looks good in the patio but there are major problems with ...
customer_reviews.text: Fire Pit looks good in the patio but there are major problems with screws provided with this fire pit during assembly. Its so expensive atleast the company should provide good quality screws or bit of their own. Be Careful screws can get stripped very easily even with slightest pressure, you will end up stripping them, Assembly instructions are not clear, plus confusing pictures. Plan for at least 4 hours. If you assemble some part wrong and your screw is stripped, then plan for whole day...
customer_reviews.author: Jeet

customer_reviews.title: Stone top falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Set this up on our back deck. Love the atmosphere and warmth it gives. Only thing is it’s our second summer with this and the stone tabletop is falling apart already. You’d think it would last a little longer than a season and a half with how much it cost.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: This fire table is amazing! Assembly is easier than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This fire table is amazing! Assembly is easier than I thought... It took my 8 year old son a little over than two hours to assemble - with my supervision and help for the heavy parts :). It looks really good, lots of happy faces sitting around this last night. My concerns when buying this were: if the flame would be high enough, if there was a bad smell, if it put out any heat. The flame is plenty high, the smell wears off after being on for a bit, and there is heat that is put out, not a ton but it's more than I expected. Totally recommend this as a center piece to your backyard / outdoor space
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect longevity on the slate tile top
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this for five years now. Replaced the igniter but that wasn’t unexpected. Now, however, the slate top is cracking and the tiles are just falling off in chunks. I want to save it so am looking to retile the top with some form of mosaic glass.
customer_reviews.author: John G. Geoghegan

customer_reviews.title: Great and read Max Power review for insight
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful and worth every penny. There are afew quirks about assembly so read the review before mine by Max Power which is thorough and right on. Things like never tighten the screws one at a time because the holes elsewhere might not line up perfect I learned the hard way by having to loosen up to move pieces enough to get the screws in I was working with. We love it, looked really great and look forward to many years of use. It is clearly the best on the market from all the others ones we considered.
customer_reviews.author: California Papa

customer_reviews.title: Follow up review
customer_reviews.text: After attempting to use this unit several times, either the smell of the propane or the smell of the burnt lava rocks is making us nauseated. It’s unbearable and my intention is to return it. It looks a really nice but needs means of adjusting the air/fuel ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Williams

customer_reviews.title: "protective cover" offers little protection and is expensive to replace
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, the product is very nice. It takes a solid 2 hours to assemble and you will likely want to set of hands for at least parts of the assembly process. The "protective cover" may protect from some elements but rain is no match for this thin piece of material. You must include the price of an effective protective cover when you are comparison shopping...
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but doesn't light anymore after the first day.
customer_reviews.text: Pit took a while to install, but it was pretty straight forward once you get past the initial assignment step. The out worked the first time I used it, then it won't intake gas anymore. The same tank that works on my grill, when I connect it to the fire pit, no gas feeds into the lighting unit. Therefore, no fire. It won't light. No smell of gas. Not sure what's wrong with it. Only got to use it one day.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Love this firepit, nice fire the looks real. Little challenging to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Willow61

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY NEW TABLE!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my new fire pit table! I am a middle aged female and I was able to put this together all BY MYSELF! Took me about 2-3 hours, and I only needed help to turn the table over to finish it (you assemble it upside down). It's fantastic and worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much nicer than I had expected it to be.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this while on vacation in Florida. We had been looking at them on line and lo and behold Amazon offered this unit for us to peruse. We thought the price was fair and ordered it hoping all would go well. And it did. First it was to be delivered between 3:00 and 7:00. I arrived home at 3:00 to begin the four hour wait. The truck showed up at 3:06, nice! It took about an hour to assemble. It aligned nicely and the quality was more than I had expected. We carried it to the deck, lit is up and smiled at ourselves. Nice job Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: L. Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: Very Very heavy, the tiles eventually broke apart and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very Very heavy, the tiles eventually broke apart and it puts out no heat. overpriced, just buy a fire pit
customer_reviews.author: TLB

customer_reviews.title: Blue Rhino Gas Firepit review.
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything I hoped it would be in that it sets an enticing ambience and gives off nice flame/heat for these cool Fall evenings on my new patio. I'd definitely recommend it. We had our landscaping guy build it and he said it should take "twenty minutes" to put together. It took him and his brother nearly an hour, so that would be the only drawback. Otherwise, it's definitely a great choice for a gas fire pit. I looked at many before ordering thise one. I decided on it because of the large ledge it offers and the 20 lb gas tank--everyone is impressed with it. Ruth [...]
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Zavitsanos

customer_reviews.title: Final Product is great, but you need to modify parts.
customer_reviews.text: Like the other reviewers, I too found the assembly a challenge. The final product is great, it performs as advertised. It produces a warm glowing fire and looks great doing it. To fix the assembly issues I replaced the aluminum screws that come with the unit with self threading #10 x half inch screws. This modification made the assembly much tighter and easier. I also had one piece come broken from the seller. One phone call and one email later, I had the new part shipped to my home within 3 days. Great customer service:)
customer_reviews.author: J Snosrap

customer_reviews.title: Overall it seems to be good quality. I like the tile edging and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This took me about 2 hours to put together by myself. Keep it upside until almost the end when you're assembling this. Overall it seems to be good quality. I like the tile edging and the hidden propane tank. The free cover was a nice bonus. I would recommend this fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Has many problems in leaking gas. I got a replacement tank hose from Home Depot because the original, and the OEM provided replacement were leaking constantly (UL Listed ?? I doubt it was was really listed). Fire pan rusted in a single year and the logs are OK. For the price paid with free shipping Im impressed. (It's really heavy)
customer_reviews.author: Clay Melugin

customer_reviews.title: It's fine as a fire pit but we purchased it because ...
customer_reviews.text: It's fine as a fire pit but we purchased it because we wanted the ceramic logs, we've had it a little over 2 months and the logs have broken. One broke in half and another broke into several pieces. It's not like we use it every night, it's only been used a handful of times. Overpriced for quality of product. Also cover tore almost as soon as item was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with everyone else....set aside a couple hours to assemble this BUT it is well worth the time! Instructions were self explanatory and just know that there are some areas that small hands work better. The slate top was heavy but I made sure to have it on an outdoor carpet and flipping it over wasn't easy but I could do it myself. You need to be close to feel the heat but it is such an awesome piece in my outdoor patio! I get compliments all the time. It is beautiful just sitting there.
customer_reviews.author: OC Gal

customer_reviews.title: Once I'd convinced her that a wood fire would burn her house down, she loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Sent as gift to my sister in VA: just the thing to make her octagonal, hanging deck... once I'd convinced her that a wood fire would burn her house down! She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: David Millson

customer_reviews.title: nice heat. I may try to sand down the ...
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described. I've had it about 2 years now, has held up well...there is 'some' rust under the burner, but since I have forgotten to cover it that would certainly be expected. Works well, nice heat. I may try to sand down the small amount of rust next season and try to reprime/paint. I would buy again and for the price compared to 'other' places was great. Friends/family always ask where I got it, and love it.
customer_reviews.author: DRCNY

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire Pit, not for Fire Glass though!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fire pit. I bought fire glass to change out the lava.. don't do it.. it won't work.. I should have read more of the specifications I guess, but I missed where fire glass wouldn't work. The lava rock isn't bad, and the logs are kindof nice and heat up nicely. I am going to buy some additional lava though as I don't think there is enough to cover the grill where you can't see down into the pit.! Overall, really enjoy it, didn't take that long to put togehter and fired up the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Long

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: 2 hours to install by myself, not hard at all, instructions are well written and coming from factory it lights up pretty well! Delivery was awesome as well, they brought it all the way to my backyard porch and delivered when you wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor Firebowl
customer_reviews.text: I received this on Friday and when opening the box noticed that the stone work on the top was damaged. I contacted Blue Rhino right away and they sent me a new top very quickly. I received the new top on Wednesday. I was really impressed with their customer service. It is a beautiful fire pit although it has been leaving some black on the logs. It was difficult to assemble but I figure that comes with the territory. I really like sitting by it on a cool night!!
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Servello

customer_reviews.title: Solid top nice outside piece
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice firepit. The metal sides and frame feel they should have been a thicker gauge steel. The top is nice and solid. The fire isn't the most impressive, but I believe it can be safely modified to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: John De Mill

customer_reviews.title: Great product that lasts.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second blue rhino propane table. The first was never covered and lasted through 6 years of chilly winters and saltwater (we live on the jersey shore) not mention a few famous hurricanes. This new table looks to be better quality then the first and I'm sure it will last equally as long if not longer. Puts out a significant amount of heat and is easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: A. Maranello

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. The only thing that I didn't see in ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly went smooth. My daughter helped my husband put it together. He suggested not to tighten screws until section that you are working on is lined up. Very sturdy. The only thing that I didn't see in reviews was the smell and smoke we saw when we first started using it. That happened the first night and gradually went away with each use. We closely examined fire pit to make sure no packaging was causing it, it seemed to be coming from the bottom of the bowl. Love that it came with a tank cover. We bought some extra lava rocks to add over time. We highly recommend this fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Stahl

customer_reviews.title: This firepit is very nice, but PLEASE take my advice and do NOT ...
customer_reviews.text: This firepit is very nice, but PLEASE take my advice and do NOT put the included "lava rocks" in with it. We put them on and when we lit the fire it smelled very chemically. This went on for a while after a few burns, so we finally decided to take the "lava rocks" out. Well, the "rocks" must be some strange plastic chemical fake rock, because they literally melted to the grate. We were able to peel all of them off, but I'm guessing years later we'll find out this shaved years off of our lives. So, spare yourself the creepy fake rocks, go get some fire glass or just use the fake logs, and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED review: We got this fire pit in 2012 and it still works perfectly! It's a really nice, well constructed & good looking unit. It does take time to assemble, and you'll need help when putting some of the parts together, but it's totally worth it for the price. It puts out a decent amount of heat and the table around it is very convenient. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: B.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Thank Goodnes for 'Mr. Handyman'!!!
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness I hired a Pro to put this together! After reading all the reviews I decided I didn't have the time, patience or tools to put this unit together. It took 'Mr. Handyman' 23/4 hours to assemble! It cost me a few bucks extra and at this stage of my life I really don't need the headaches of assembling a complex piece like this. Even the 'Pro' had his issues with instructions and asembly. Nice solid unit, works well and looks good!...Thank You Blue Rhino and THANK YOU!!! ...'Mr. Handyman' Arizona!!!
customer_reviews.author: ex gardeners in the hood

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to my pool area!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Fire table. Glad I was able to purchase before the price went up :) As others mentioned, this took me about 2 hours to put together. Definitely use two people when you flip it over. I tried to do it by myself and broke the weld on one of the feet. I was able to fix it myself but do it the right way. Use two people! It also would have been easier to put together with a second person. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hannifin

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to every one who wrote reviews and answered questions. Also thanks to the 2 assembly videos on youtube. I bought one and just built it today. Took the mentioned 3 hours and the hardest was the attachment of the burner assembly on top and the bottom. Everything else went very smoothly. Slight aroma with the first lighting but that seems to be dissipating. The aroma now seems to be gone and there is very slight smoke but no real soot to speak of. The logs did get really burnt but it's a fire right. Had the local sheet metal company make this cover. Overall a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Seveets

customer_reviews.title: Great fire table until it falls apart!
customer_reviews.text: This table was great until this summer. Uncovered it for it’s first use and number of tiles fell off. So if you like a nice fireplace for 3 years and then it falls apart by this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL WAY TO END THE DAY
customer_reviews.text: WE WERE ABLE TO GET A WONDERFUL PRICE WITH FREE DELIVERY. HOWEVER WE HAD TO HIRE SOMEONE TO PUT IT TOGETHER [MAYBE IN MY YOUNGER DAYS I COULD, BUT AT 72 DIDN'T WANT TO TRY]. I FOUND THAT A HARDWARE STORE MIGHT BE HIRE TO PUT IT TOGETHER, BUT WE HIRED APPLIANCE REPAIR PERSON WHO WAS AVAIALBE IN AN HOUR. IT TOOK ABOUT AN HOUR AND HALF AND THEY KNEW WHAT THEY WERE DOING. WE HAVE USED THE FIREBOWL ALMOST EVERY NIGHT FOR AN HOUR OR SO AT SUNSET. IT DOES NOT GENERATE A LOT OF HEAT, BUT IS COMFORTABLE AND WONDERFUL TO LOOK AT IN THE SETTING SUN. I WISH I HAD PURCHASE IT EARLIER.
customer_reviews.author: George L. Koski

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Only two hours to assemble and easy to follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best price I found and great looking on our patio. Very durable and not too complicated to build
customer_reviews.author: Leanne Alfrey

customer_reviews.title: It comes with a cover!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this fire pit - it really throws out the heat! I did however, buy a separate cover as suggested here at Amazon - but when I opened the box for the pit it already has a very nice cover included! I will be returning the extra cover now. There's also a cover that goes around the propane tank underneath - making it black so you can't see it through the grates of the base, very clever. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: pilatesgirlsocal

customer_reviews.title: The stone work is fantastic and it works great
customer_reviews.text: A pain to put together but is worth it. The stone work is fantastic and it works great. Also make sure you buy more volcanic rock for firepit. 2 more bags.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great firepit!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together. Really need 2 people to turn it over once assembled. Not all the screw holes lined up perfectly, but they weren't all needed either. I had a problem starting it the first time because the instructions said to turn to start. Nothing happened. I had to look up instructions on YouTube and found I had to push in once it was at the start position. That made all the difference. It's great on these cool Pacific Northwest Spring nights.
customer_reviews.author: The Jedi Way

customer_reviews.title: Could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 3 yrs now, and it seldom gets used. The flame is pretty low, but we have roasted marshmallows over it. During the winter the cover keeps getting torn off by the wind despite my tying down the corners last year; the fabric is not very strong. It does not come with any mechanism for securing it to the firepit. This year I have used a rope all the way around it to see if that will work. Consequently the top is not weathering well and is flaking off. This is in a cold, snowy, very windy climate, so that might not be a problem elsewhere. It is a good size for my small deck.
customer_reviews.author: Judith G.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice firepit for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice firepit for the money. It doesn't give off a lot of heat but that's not the reason I bought it.We just enjoy sitting outside with the fire on and enjoy a drink and music. I did modify it to burn fireglass. Basically I took expanded stainless steel and put it over the existing grate and bolted them together.I do get a little soot on the glass but I still like the looks of the glass over the rocks and fake logs. I also would guess that I got 8-10 hrs out of a tank of propane. All in all a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Chadd Buurma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: we are very pleased lot of fun to set on porch and relax by the fire
customer_reviews.author: pateicia sauceda

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition to the patio!!!
customer_reviews.text: A amazing quality, but the directions should read 3+ hours to assemble rather than 1. Worth the effort however, and so far we are happy with this product. Should be a few warnings about assembling the doors to the top about getting the proper flush fitting before you get all the sections screwed together. You have to remember you are putting it together upside down😆. All in all well worth the savings over fully assembled units offered in patio shops and retail outlets. Have recommended to several people.
customer_reviews.author: Kmac

customer_reviews.title: Great looking firepit!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this firepit for our recently updated backyard and are very pleased! I'm really glad we read the reviews beforehand so we knew what to expect with the set up. It was pretty easy and took about an hour or so. Assemble it in the shade if it's a hot day...the metal parts get really hot. We love the look. Not only do they include a cover for the firepit, but a cover for the propane tank so you can't see the white tank sitting underneath. I would definitely recommend this and have to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just put it together the other night. Took a little longer than two hours. Like reviews said, best to put together panels loosely on table top and then assemble. Fas tdelivery, and well packaged.. Tank cover and fire pit cover kind of cheap and cheesy. Will need replacing. Might replace feet with heavy duty casters so can move around easier.great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AlVacado

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this. I researched A LOT and I clearly ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. I researched A LOT and I clearly made the right choice. My son put together by himself, took about 2 hours. Easy to start. It is just starting to get cooler, but so far it kicks out good heat.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia LaValley

customer_reviews.title: Be patient during assembly
customer_reviews.text: We use the fire pit on our back patio. Creates a nice atmosphere towards dark. The down side was the igniter. It stopped working the 2nd time I lit the pit. Overall still easier than building and filling a wood burning fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great firepit but a bit difficult to assemble and cover is awful
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic firepit. Item was delivered by truck as it is extremely heavy. It is almost impossible to assemble without another person. The sheetmetal does not always fit correctly (I needed to file a couple of places with a sheet metal file to get proper alignment). Also, the cover that is supplied with the unit is junk. It has 3 tears in it only after a couple of weeks outside.
customer_reviews.author: K. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, big hit with all who join us on the deck.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ristuccia

customer_reviews.title: Not much heat!
customer_reviews.text: We were excited about this fire pit at first. Came in promptly, looks awesome and was easy to put together. However, it does not put out a lot of heat!! You can barely feel anything. So if you're looking for a nice looking piece that provides some ambience get one. But if you're expecting to be able to get some warmth don't get it!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Slade

customer_reviews.title: A great gathering place for friends and family
customer_reviews.text: When complete, this unit is very sturdy and performs very well. It is helpful to have 2 people during assembly because the hearth is very heavy and needs to be flipped to attach the side panels. Be careful when attaching the Bowl Assembly to the Hearth - it has to face a certain way but the directions don't mention that fact (before completing step 2 look at step 3 so the Bowl Assembly is facing the right direction. Also, the top and bottom screw holes are the same on the sides so be careful to attach them correctly. I am very happy with this purchase and can't wait for the cold nights to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim DiManna

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Blue Rhino Propane firebowl. For the price, I think it is a great buy. I really wanted to buy an American product, but, unfortunately, I could not find what I wanted in my price range. The instructions could have been better, but it really wasn't too bad putting it together. It starts easily, and looks great on the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Coomie

customer_reviews.title: nice table, not as hard as they make it sound to assm.
customer_reviews.text: After many issues with the shipping, finally arrived. Was expecting to fight to get this together. Step 1, put it close to where you want it to be, very heavy...After getting the parts out of the box, take a little time to identify them. after that be sure to look at the pictures closely. It was a breeze to asm. just don't tighten the screws keys until you line the sides up. Me and mt daughter spent about an hour, and she finished it up on her own. Works excellent, very nice addition to our deck!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: patio pit table
customer_reviews.text: A little worried about sooty rocks, but I see another reviewer wrote about how to remedy this with aftermarket fix. Nice size and seems to be good quality
customer_reviews.author: Anne K.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Really the nicest any where close to this price. Delivery as promised and quality exceeded expectations. We have had many positive remarks from guests. Very pleased with another Amazon experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions could have been better but overall, I am very happy with this purchase. Took about 3 hours to put together by myself. Looks great in back yard. Functions as described and is a great addition to our vacation home. Table top is really nice and we find ourselves sitting around it even without the fire lit. More than enough room for wine glasses and small plates. I would highly recommend this fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Martorano

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and looks great. Not at all hard to assemble although it is a time consuming. The only thing i would change would be to put doors on the back also for easier cleaning and storage access.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Z.

customer_reviews.title: It looks just the photo and I was not disappointed! It is very attractive
customer_reviews.text: It looks just the photo and I was not disappointed! It is very attractive. Shipping was good and on time. It took one person 3 hours to put it together. We had no problem lighting it and the flame is beautiful and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Overall pretty nice firepit. The problem is the ignitor sucks. Not a big deal but for the price you'd think everything would be quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Winter fun
customer_reviews.text: Have to admit that the 130 lbs of metal and screws in a box were a bit intimidating. Detailed assembly instruction promised a 1hr assembly time. I took 3 hours and it worked perfectly. Very happy with the results. Great quality, works great, and I'm now better at Rubics cube 😎
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the PERFECT fire table for my yard.
customer_reviews.text: I looked for months and found it on Amazon. This one is comparable in construction, usability, and attractiveness. The difference, this one does not cost $1,500. It is a challenge to put together, took about 4 hrs...worth it!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: This piece is beautiful and we were able to put it together in ...
customer_reviews.text: This piece is beautiful and we were able to put it together in about an hour. The top piece is very colorful and the terracotta grout matches my patio concert perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Dena L. Bowmer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price. My family has enjoyed this many of nights. Beautiful piece.
customer_reviews.author: Twyla Perkins

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much we are using this. I love everything about it. It is great that they provide a dark colored bag to slip over the propane tank so that you don't even notice it under there. It also provides so much storage for other outdoors items...I keep all of our citronella candles under there. We were pleasantly surprised how much heat it throws off and are able to stay outside on cold nights. The flame is able to go much higher than we expected and we like that you can put it as high or low as you like. We highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Putting this together was not easy. Mostly because the parts don't all align and fit snugly. There are small gaps between some of the sides because of this. The top can easily crack while putting it together. I bought this for the luxury of having a fire pit on demand or off. If I had this to do over I would have gotten a less expensive propane fire pit or a real one and used timed logs. The cover it comes with is poor quality and ripped in multiple spots throughout the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Easily carried by 2 people from the garage to the patio. Looks beautiful at night when lit or even during the day when it's not
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy top - looks more expensive than it is. Deliver box close to your outdoor space. Overall very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger L.

customer_reviews.title: it's really nice
customer_reviews.text: The firepit table arrived in a big, heavy, rather flat box. It required about 3 hours to assemble by a Ph.D. engineer. But once put together it is beautiful and very convenient. The gas tank slides in and out for easy changes, and there is an ignition button. We really like it, especially with guests.
customer_reviews.author: LindaF

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, smells bad and soots horribly.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, delivery was great, easy to put together. The problem is the soot and the smell. It's actually hard to sit around it as it makes me nauseous. I haven't decided if I'm going to attempt to return but my initial impressions are not that great.
customer_reviews.author: mphclemson

product_meta.title: Endless Summer, GAD860SP, LP Gas Outdoor Firebowl with Slate/Marble Mantel
product_meta.description: Material Type:Cast IronBring the warmth and ambience of a fireplace to your patio, deck or backyard with this Endless Summer LP fire pit, by Blue Rhino. Featuring a slate mosaic tile mantel, this fire pit is complete with a decorative base, that cleverly conceals a propane tank (not included) and control panel, making it an attractive centerpiece for your outdoor living space. Complete with a 40,000 BTU cast iron burner, you can enjoy all the ambiance of a classic fire, without the mess of tending ashes. Adding to the elegance, this unit comes with lava rock and logs, which beautifully accents its flames. 1-year limited warranty and protective cover included.
feature_bullets: 40,000 BTUs will heat up to 150 sq. ft.
Beautiful multi-colored slate and marble tile table
Multi-spark electronic ignition for easy lighting and door with easy access to tank
Variable settings to set the heat or set the mood.Simple Assembly – No Tools Needed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars380 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
